project.teaser: UNLOCK CEI’s ambition is to UNLOCK the potential for accelerating the deployment of the Cloud-to-Edge-IoT (CEI) computing continuum in Europe by focusing on the demand-side drivers and challenges to identify technology-driven innovation and business opportunities driving...
project.objective: UNLOCK CEI’s ambition is to UNLOCK the potential for accelerating the deployment of the Cloud-to-Edge-IoT (CEI) computing continuum in Europe by focusing on the demand-side drivers and challenges to identify technology-driven innovation and business opportunities driving demand value chains. The project represents the CEI demand constituency; provide insights and guidance to the Horizon Europe R&D projects in this domain; and contribute to a proactive dialogue with the supply stakeholders to encourage the development of an open European CEI ecosystem. It focuses on emerging value chains where investment is needed to foster the deployment of the Cloud-to-Edge-IoT continuum through the forthcoming CEI large scale pilots. This will ultimately foster European autonomy in the digital economy. The workplan is designed to provide early results to feed into the development of the HE Work Programme in 2023-24 based on the ongoing dialogue with the stakeholder ecosystem. The project pays specific attention to data governance issues, leveraging the relationship with industry-driven initiatives such as Gaia-X and CCAM (Connected, Co-operative & Automated Mobility) partnership. UNLOCK carries out a systematic assessment of the state of the open European CEI ecosystem and develop future market scenarios and related market pathways for the development of the open European CEI ecosystem. It will engage with industry stakeholders representing the most relevant industry value chains in Europe for CEI potential demand and develops a productive and effective interface between the demand constituency and the supply side, including the coordination of HE projects resulting from CL4-2021-DATA-01-05, CL4-2022-DATA-01-02, and CL4-2022-DATA-01-03 and Cluster 3 cybersecurity projects. It finally designs and implement a coordinated communication and dissemination strategy running throughout the lifetime of the project to create awareness about the whole of the European demand-side landscape.
project.title: Unlocking the Cloud Edge IoT demand potential in Europe
project.keywords: Cloud Computing, Edge Computing, Internet of Things, Demand-side drivers, Emerging value chains, Data governance, CEI Ecosystem

result.title: D5.1 1st Updated Communications, dissemination and engagement plan
result.description: This report outlines stakeholder groups & targeted communications, dissemination and engagement activities.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - UNLOCK-CEI (Unlocking the Cloud Edge IoT demand potential in Europe)
result.teaser: UNLOCK-CEI’s aims to facilitate and accelerate the deployment of the Cloud-to-Edge-IoT (CEI) computing continuum in Europe by focusing on the demand-side drivers and challenges to identify technology-driven innovation and business opportunities driving demand value chains...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: D.1.3 Cloud-Edge-IoT Demand Landscape
result.description: This report will provide a comprehensive and detailed analysis of the actual and potential demand ecosystem of Cloud-Edge-IoT, starting with a baseline report based on desk research and a custom survey in m.6, with updates every 6 month. The report will feed into the dialogue with stakeholders and contribute to the scenarios developed in WP2.

result.title: D5.1 2nd Uodated Communications, dissemination and engagement plan
result.description: This report outlines stakeholder groups & targeted communications, dissemination and engagement activities.

result.title: D.1.1 Cloud-Edge-IoT Demand Landscape
result.description: This report will provide a comprehensive and detailed analysis of the actual and potential demand ecosystem of CloudEdgeIoT starting with a baseline report based on desk research and a custom survey in m6 with updates every 6 month The report will feed into the dialogue with stakeholders and contribute to the scenarios developed in WP2

result.title: D5.2 Updated EU Demand side Radar
result.description: Reports on landscape radar results including demand side overview.

result.title: D6.2 Updated Data Management Plan
result.description: Reports in details the types of data managed by the project, the adopted strategy to ensure data is findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable and defines the procedures for preservation storage and curation.

result.title: D4.1 Technology scoping paper
result.description: A detailed overview of the technologies which are being developed within the CEI domain and portfolio projects with an emphasis on maturity and interrelations.

result.title: D3.2 Revised structure for CEI Service Requirements
result.description: This report will include the collected insights from the workshop regarding the validation of the service requirements by the demand constituency.

result.title: D6.2 Data Management Plan
result.description: Reports in details the types of data managed by the project the adopted strategy to ensure data is findable accessible interoperable and reusable and defines the procedures for preservation storage and curation

result.title: D5.2 EU Demand side Radar
result.description: Reports on landscape radar results including demand side overview.

result.title: D6.1 Risk report
result.description: The first version M6 contains the list of initially identified risks together with the foreseen corrective measures to be adopted

result.title: D5.3 User stories and policy briefs booklet
result.description: Collection of user stories and policy briefs published and disseminated throughout the project.

result.title: D3.3 Report on CEI Service Requirements
result.description: The results of the workshops will be analysed and sanitized to create a public report, with a detailed analysis of cross-domain similarities and differences, any unique business or service requirements by domain, key factors influencing relative preferences between offerings and alternative market scenarios, and preliminary indications of framework and enabling conditions required to motivate creation of market scenarios that would may offer advantages for European sovereignty and autonomy in the CEI marketplace. A draft handout of the report will be submitted at M18.

result.title: D4.2 Commercial Feasibility Tool
result.description: A self-assessment tool for tech developers to provide a scoring and evaluation of the relevance, value chains and key market scenarios for their technology.

result.title: D5.4 Updated Sustainability Plan
result.description: Summarising all major results, KERs, KPIs and KIPs with CEIsupply.eu sustainability model and partner signed MoU.

result.title: D5.1 Communications, dissemination and engagement plan
result.description: This report outlines stakeholder groups targeted communications dissemination and engagement activities

result.title: D4.4 Market developments learnings
result.description: A summative report which reflects on the progress of the tech developers with regards to market readiness and the challenges in defining their exploitation pathways.

result.title: D.2.3 Final Position Paper on the future Open European CEI Ecosystem
result.description: Summative findings of consultations with demand constituency and cross-domain expert panel on desired future CEI market scenarios, development pathways, and recommended actions for stakeholders.

result.title: D6.1 Updated Risk report
result.description: The final version will include the emerged risks, the adopted measures and the impact on the project.

result.title: D.1.2 Cloud-Edge-IoT Demand Landscape
result.description: This report will provide a comprehensive and detailed analysis of the actual and potential demand ecosystem of Cloud-Edge-IoT, starting with a baseline report based on desk research and a custom survey in m.6, with updates every 6 month. The report will feed into the dialogue with stakeholders and contribute to the scenarios developed in WP2.

result.title: D3.1 CEI ecosystems overview with the value chain adopter groups
result.description: This report will provide an overview about the stakeholders who will involve industrial associations and organizations contributing to demand pull In this way this report will feed into the Demand Landscape and contribute to the CEI Adoption Readiness Framework and CEI Demand Market Scenarios developed in WP2

result.title: D.2.2 Preliminary Market Scenarios & Pathways to the Future Open European CEI Ecosystem
result.description: D2.2. documents the full set of preliminary market scenarios, evaluation of desirability and decision points, to be validated by the expert panel (T.2.3).

result.title: D.2.1 Readiness Framework and Service Requirements
result.description: Readiness framework establishes a common structure for exploring CEI market dynamics. Service requirements provide a baseline against which suppliers can benchmark their planned offerings. Initial draft of D.2.1 ready in M6 to support Wave 1 Workshops and finalized in M12 to support Wave 2 Workshops with Value Chain Adopter Groups.

result.title: D5.3 Updated User stories and policy briefs booklet
result.description: Collection of user stories and policy briefs published and disseminated throughout the project.

category.title: internet of things
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/internet/internet of things

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
